name: ado-discord-webhook
description: Allows the sending of custom messages to a Discord Webhook URL
author: Robert Burke

inputs.name: content
inputs.label: Message Content
inputs.helpMarkDown: Allows only a simple, message and supports Discord markdown

inputs.name: embeds
inputs.label: Embeds
inputs.helpMarkDown: This allows for a more complex, JSON-driven definition of your message which is injected into the [embeds](https://discordapp.com/developers/docs/resources/webhook#execute-webhook) property.

inputs.name: tts
inputs.label: Text to Speech
inputs.helpMarkDown: This allows for the message content to be spoken out loud.

inputs.name: updateMessageMode
inputs.label: Update Message Mode
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies if and how you want to update an already existing message. 'none' does not update an existing message, 'edit' modifies an existing message, 'replace' deletes an existing message and creates a new one. Default: 'none'

inputs.name: updateMessageId
inputs.label: Update Message ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies which message to update. Defaults to environment variable 'discordWebhookLastMessageId', which is automatically set when a message is successfully created. If you need the messageId from another job or stage, you could utilize the output variable 'discordWebhookMessageId', which is also set by this task.
